function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Relying solely on digital technology for pandemic policy and response may lead to a false sense of security.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Privacy infringement and increased risk among individuals with mental illness or restricted access to necessities.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rapid diagnosis and risk prediction of covid-19 through ai and machine learning algorithms","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of cloud-based ai-assisted ct service for detecting covid-19 pneumonia","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Global availability of open-source deep convolutional neural network design for detecting covid-19 cases","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of compliance with quarantine and isolation measures","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inaccurate reporting of symptoms in self-reported surveys","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of digital technology for quarantine and self-isolation monitoring","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of ai-powered surveillance for monitoring and restricting public gatherings","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Enforcement of quarantine with tracking devices and fines","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential privacy concerns with the collection and storage of personal health data through mobile applications.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk of missed exposure and contact tracing due to the absence of mobile phones or mobile service.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low adoption rates of contact tracing applications leading to reduced effectiveness of the mitigation strategy.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ai predictive models trained on chinese samples may not be generalizable to other populations.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Noise from social media and online traffic may lead to overfitted ai models and inaccurate trend predictions.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of big data and ai for tracking people and infection spread","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Integration of mobile phones and social media for real-time data collection","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Real-time data reporting and sharing within healthcare organizations","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unspecific signal in rt-qpcr testing","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Variability in viral shedding from infected persons and uncertainty in viral gene copies detected in human excreta.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Variations in virus rna recovery affecting correlations","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty in estimated prevalence data","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Variability in catchment area sizes and wastewater flow","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Correlation between measured sars-cov-2 load and estimated covid-19 cases","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unspecific signal in rt-qpcr due to environmental contaminants","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential false-positive results due to environmental contaminants affecting pcr","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Analysis of bioindicators in wastewater to estimate population can lead to inaccurate assessments and decision-making.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Variability in pcr measurements and storage conditions for rna extraction","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disturbing factors accumulated during sample processing that could influence analysis results","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Estimation of covid-19 cases based on sewer network connections","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The prevalence of reported covid-19 cases in the wwtp catchment area may indicate a higher risk of potential contamination in the water supply.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of understanding about the correlation between wastewater-based analysis and acute infection cases","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Questionable research practices in dutch institutes","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Data sharing statements from covid-19 trials","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Researchers unwilling to share data leading to lack of transparency in clinical trials","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Academic focus on quantity of publications over quality and rigor of science","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Promotion of open science without concrete efforts to improve research quality","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on preprints for public-health decisions without robust filtering","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Flawed or potentially fraudulent studies being used in meta-analyses to promote ivermectin as a wonder drug","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of scrutiny and blind trust in academic research culture","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spreading of disinformation through social media and mainstream media","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Pitfalls of pandemic publishing raising questions about peer-review processes, scientific integrity, and data fraud","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Amplification of flawed trial data through unreliable meta-analyses","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failures in peer review leading to publication of low-quality or misleading research","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Scandals involving faked research data eroding trust in peer review and scientific integrity","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dissemination of unsubstantiated claims about the effectiveness of ivermectin in treating covid-19.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inaccurate data from the now-discredited surgisphere database influencing treatment recommendations and national policies.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Preprints with questionable or fraudulent information being used to support ineffective treatments","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Misleading or incorrect preprints leading to the dissemination of unreliable information","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rapid dissemination of preprints without critical review or verification","category":"Health","confidence":"High"}]}
